answers.answer: maybe Her Dr. need to be spoken to by u, no the nursing home. because most of them could care less. I woked in them for yrs. And if she isn't eating well for all her meals that can be a problem also. And the food in nursing home can be very high in carbs also. I bet its the ups and downs of her blood sugars. U might better ask the Dr at the upper left of this page in blue ti says ASK A DOCTOR just click on diabetes-type 2, I hope u find the help your Mom needs. I worked in many nursing homes and I loved all the people life they were my family, but most don't treat them this way.

question: My Mom is in a nursing home.  She is 88 years old and has been insulin dependent about 3 years.  The past few months they are unable to keep her levels stable.  Either too high or dangerously low.  She is very irritable and complains of not feeling well but can't pinpoint what exactly ails her.  She is legally blind from glaucoma.  Is on high blood pressure med and high cholesterol meds.  Help?!
title: Unable sugar levels
